definitions.definition: ( geometry ) Of two objects, at right angles ; perpendicular to each other.
examples: A chord and the radius that bisects it are orthogonal .

subdefinitions.definition: Of a pair of vectors: having a zero inner product ; perpendicular .
examples: The normal vector and tangent vector at a given point are orthogonal .

subdefinitions.definition: Of a square matrix : such that its transpose is equal to its inverse .
Of a linear transformation : preserving its angles .
Of grid graphs, board games and polyominoes: vertical or horizontal but not diagonal .
Of a pair of elements in an ortholattice : each less than or equal to the orthocomplement of the other.

definitions.definition: ( statistics ) Statistically independent , with reference to variates.
( software engineering ) Of two or more aspects of a problem, able to be treated separately; of a design, exhibiting consistency and composability .
examples: The content of the message should be orthogonal to the means of its delivery.

definitions.definition: Of two or more problems or subjects, independent of or irrelevant to each other.

main_definition: ( geometry ) Of two objects, at right angles ; perpendicular to each other.
secondary_definitions: ( statistics ) Statistically independent , with reference to variates.
( software engineering ) Of two or more aspects of a problem, able to be treated separately; of a design, exhibiting consistency and composability .
Of two or more problems or subjects, independent of or irrelevant to each other.
